title: drama festival curtailed due coronavirus
story: Driver was well over the drink drive limitDrama Festival curtailed due to coronavirusNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsDrama Festival curtailed due to coronavirusPortadown Drama Festival is being cut short due to the coronavirus outbreak.By The NewsroomTuesday, th March , : am""The main prize winners at the final night of the  Portadown Speech Festival pictued with the  party. INPT-. : -TONY HENDRONNNIt had been hoped the drama element of the festival could continue till its planned close on Friday but the festival committee has now taken the decion to cut it short.The move comes after the committee agreed to cancel other festival events in the coming weeks.A spokesperson for the festival said: “In light of the new directive from the Government re the advice about non-essential social contact,the Director of Portadown Drama Festival announced that the Drama Festival was closing after Monday night’s play. Rosemary Drama Group with their production of “These Shining Lives” gave an outstanding performance of a very poignant story and brought the curtain down on our  Festival.“Portadown Festival Association would like to take this opportunity of thanking all our performers, teachers, parents, volunteers and sponsors for their support and loyalty to us over the years but particularly in these unprecedented circumstances.“Please exercise caution and be very careful as we embark on the days ahead of us. Keep safe everyone.”In an earlier statement the festival committee said “In the light of current circumstances and after close and continued monitoring of the outbreak of COVID-it is with regret that the decision has been made to cancel the upcoming Portadown Festival Association sections as follows: Irish Folk Dancing, Saturday, March –Saturday, March  Music Monday, March  – Saturday, April  and Dance Friday, April –Saturday, May .“This dficult decision has not been taken lightly, but ultimately, the health and safety of our performers, audience, volunteers and adjudicators is paramount. We are all bitterly disappointed but do hope you understand. “All teachers, schools and parents who have entered children in these Sections will be contacted immediately.“Entry fees will be refunded in due course and we respectfully ask for your patience in this regard.“We would like to thank you for your continued support of PortadownFestival and look forward to welcoming you back again in ! title: coronavirus omagh cinema to leave every second seat empty
story: Omaghs Omniplex cineman facility is introducing a seat separation policy in response to coronavirus.In a bid to prevent the spread of Covid-, every second seat will be left unoccupied in a checkerboard pattern. Omniplexs announcement comes after a decision was taken to cancel the St Patricks Day parades in Omagh and Enniskillen due to coronavirus fears at Tuesday nights meeting of Fermanagh and Omagh District Councils Regeneration and Community Committee.A statement from Omniplex said: Every second seat in every screen is locked off as ‘unoccupied’ so that it can’t be bought. You can of course still sit in the unoccupied seats next to your friends and family. This will leave a gap of seats between you and our next customer.We encourage our guests to use hand sanitisers provided, cough sneeze into a tissue and place in the bin, place your cinema rubbish in the bins provided on your way out, wash your hands for  seconds with soap and water and to use contactless payments when possible.  addthis, Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT title: coronavirus strule house closes
story: Fermanagh and Omagh District Council has temporarily closed its Strule House premises on High Street, Omagh.The building has been closed as a precautionary measure due to a member of staff having had contact with a person who has tested positive for COVID-. The member of staff is following PHA guidance.Strule House will now undergo a deep clean as a further precautionary measure.Staff based in Strule House have been notied and advised to stay at home until further notice.Chairperson of Fermanagh and Omagh District Council, Councillor Siobhaacuten Currie, said: This is an anxious time for many within our local community. The safety and welfare of Council staff and the general public is priority. The Council has been liaising with the PHA in relation to this matter and continues to act in accordance with its advice.I would like to reassure people that Strule House has been closed as a precaution, with the building remaining closed until deep cleaning is complete.I urge people to be ever mindful of protecting themselves and others from COVID- by adhering to PHA advice and guidance and by following good hygiene and handwashing practices.Fermanagh and Omagh District Council continues to monitor and review the situation with regard to COVID- and its potential impacts. Council offices at The Grange, Omagh continue to operate as normal. Members of the public wishing to make contact with Council services normally located in Strule House should telephone    or visit the Council offices at The Grange.  addthis, Leave your commentTyrone
